intro: Goniothalamus longirostris, commonly known as the long-beaked goniothalamus, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Annonaceae and is characterized by its smooth, gray bark and lanceolate leaves. The plant produces fragrant, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by oval, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland and hill forest regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
